docs.snippet: The opioid epidemic killed more than 33,000 people in 2015. What follows are stories of a national affliction that has swept the country, from cities on the West Coast to bedroom communities in the Northeast.

headline.print_headline: Opioid Tide From Coast to Coast
headline.main: Inside a Killer Drug Epidemic: A Look at America’s Opioid Crisis

docs.snippet: Many companies don’t know that their ads are appearing next to abhorrent content. Tell them.

headline.main: How to Destroy the Business Model of Breitbart and Fake News

docs.snippet: Roughly 4,000 service members helped clean up the Enewetak Atoll from nuclear tests. Many now have ailments they think result from the work, but the government won’t provide health care.

headline.print_headline: Veterans Feel Cost of U.S. Nuclear Tests
headline.main: Troops Who Cleaned Up Radioactive Islands Can’t Get Medical Care

docs.snippet: We all face financial trade-offs. Needs over wants. Faith over financial facts. A dozen people from around the country share their stories.

headline.print_headline: Basing Life on What You Can Afford
headline.main: Basing Life on What You Can Afford

docs.snippet: The press may not yet know how to cover the president, but the president knows exactly what to do with the press: Humiliate them.

headline.main: Donald Trump and the Theater of Access

docs.snippet: Another in our series about helping students find trustworthy information at a time when “fake news” is headline news.

headline.print_headline: Ideas for E.L.L.s: Finding Reliable Sources in a World of ‘Fake News’
headline.main: Ideas for E.L.L.s: Finding Reliable Sources in a World of ‘Fake News’

docs.snippet: After a turbulent summer, the N.B.A.’s newest “villain” is finding peace and building an empire among the Bay Area’s techies.

headline.main: How Kevin Durant Became Silicon Valley’s Hottest Start-up

docs.snippet: Current and former Rockettes find themselves in a new spotlight as they take sides over the inauguration, breaking with the solidarity that defines the troupe.

headline.print_headline: Still Kicking, but No Longer Silent
headline.main: A Trump Inauguration Casualty: The Silent, Smiling Rockettes

docs.snippet: A discarded photo album reveals a rich history of black lives, from the segregated South to Harlem dance halls to a pretty block in Crown Heights.

headline.main: Love and Black Lives, in Pictures Found on a Brooklyn Street

docs.snippet: Summer Zervos, a former contestant on Donald J. Trump’s reality television show, sued Mr. Trump for defamation, describing behavior that spilled into assault.

headline.main: Former ‘Apprentice’ Contestant Sues Trump for Defamation
